result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick John White

records.addlTxt: Confirmed video with DCI for 11-14-2022 as State does not oppose video appearance for sentencing
Letter received from Atty Buckett

Reset Sentencing hearing from 10-6-2022 to on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am as defendant recently transferred to DCI.  
D's NCH mailed to DCI
Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume controlled substance without valid prescription.
Disposition Form - PSI

Clerk: EZ.Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee Co. Jail.  Attorney Robert Buckett appeared by video for Derrick John White.  (22CF3; Ozaukee Co. 22CF170)   Defendant waives right to appear in person.  Atty. Buckett states the cases were stalled based on crime lab results and defendant is requesting to resolve the cases.  State advises is still awaiting results of the testing.  State advises upon plea to Count 1, request Count 2 be dismissed for read-in and request a PSI with both sides are free to argue sentence.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1, Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and enters judgment.  Court dismissed Count 2 and 22CF3 for read-in.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Court requests the defendant appear in person for the sentencing hearing.  State shall prepare an OTP.  Court cancels the warrant and bail forfeiture and cash bond reinstated.  Court does not revoke bond.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Hearing on July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Confirmed Zoom with Ozaukee Co. Jail, mailed D's NOH to Oz. Co. Jail.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $2000.00

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White not in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Derrick John White.  (22CF3; Ozaukee Co. 22CF170)  Case called at 8:34 a.m.  Atty. Buckett states the defendant is in holding at the Ozaukee Co. jail awaiting clearing the Ozaukee Co. warrant and has sent a picture that reflects the inside of Ozaukee Co. jail.
Reset Hearing from 5-12-2022 to on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am due to conflict by counsel.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Derrick John White.  (22CF3)  Atty. Buckett states awaiting test results on the controlled substance in Count 1.
Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Robert Buckett appeared in court for Derrick John White. Clerk: EZ. (22CF3)  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered.
Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on March 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared in court, Attorney Robert Buckett appeared in court for Derrick John White. Counsel's first appearance. Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Defense motions to amend bond. Court takes notice of document number 8: motion for reduction of bail.  Argument from Defense, State.  Court takes judicial notices of defendants pending charges and denies the motion for modification of bond.
Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arraignment on March 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/consume controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared by zoom video, in custody at Washington Co Jail, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Derrick John White. Clerk: EZ. (22CF3)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests $2,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Leech requests lower cash bond or signature bond.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
